title: RDP Screen Size
author: bradyjay3
body_snippet:
I've noticed that RDP connections don't size the screen display/resolution correctly in windows 10.  If i have a high resolution but the zoom is set to 150% mRemoteNG doesn't pass that zoom through to the RDP session like Windows Remote Desktop will.  You can see the difference on how small the text is in mRemoteNG vs Windows RD

![Windows RD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42389197/87560979-46d61880-c679-11ea-8a88-64780cb68182.PNG)
![mRemoteNG](https://user-images.githubuserconten...

iterations.description: DeviceScaleFactor is hardcoded to 100 in RdpProtocol.cs instead of auto-detecting the local device DPI, causing blurry or incorrectly scaled RDP sessions when the host system uses >100% DPI scaling.

notes:
AI triage (claude): DeviceScaleFactor is hardcoded to 100 in RdpProtocol.cs instead of auto-detecting the local device DPI, causing blurry or incorrectly scaled RDP sessions when the host system uses >100% DPI scaling.
Approach: Replace hardcoded DeviceScaleFactor=100 with a computed value from ResolutionScalingFactor (same DPI source already used for DesktopScaleFactor Auto mode), ensuring both extended properties reflect actual device DPI.
